history.proof: intros. unfold Zp_invertible in *. destruct H as [i Hx]. destruct H0 as [j Hy]. exists (i ⊗ j). rewrite Zp_mult_assoc. scongruence use: Zp_mult_assoc, Zp_mult_one_r, Zp_mult_comm.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
p: nat
Hp: p <> 0
y: Z_Zp
x: Z_Zp

Goal:
Zp_invertible x -> Zp_invertible y -> Zp_invertible (x ⊗ y)

Premises:
Zp_invertible = fun x => exists i : Z_Zp, i ⊗ x = Op : Z_Zp -> Prop
Zp_opp_invertible : forall x, Zp_invertible x < -> Zp_invertible (∸ x)
Zp_invertible_spec : forall x, Zp_invertible x < -> is_gcd p (proj1_sig x) 1
Nat.div_mod : forall x y : nat, y <> 0 -> x = y * (x / y) + x mod y
no_common_prime_is_coprime : forall x y : nat, x <> 0 -> (forall p : nat, prime p -> divides p x -> divides p y -> False) -> is_gcd x y 1
Zp_prime_invert : prime p -> forall x, x <> Zp -> {i : Z_Zp | i ⊗ x = Op}
mk_rt : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), (forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x) -> (forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x)) -> (forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z)) -> (forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x) -> (forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x)) -> (forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z)) -> (forall x y z : R, req (rmul (radd x y) z) (radd (rmul x z) (rmul y z))) ->...-> ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req
Z.le = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y)%Z <> Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
Zp_mult_assoc : forall x y z : Z_Zp, x ⊗ (y ⊗ z) = x ⊗ y ⊗ z
measure_rect : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> nat) (P : X -> Type), (forall x : X, (forall y : X, m y < m x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall x : X, P x
Zp_mult_comm : forall x y, x ⊗ y = y ⊗ x
Zp_mult_plus_distr_l : forall x y z : Z_Zp, x ⊗ (y ⊕ z) = x ⊗ y ⊕ x ⊗ z
Zp_mult_plus_distr_r : forall x y z : Z_Zp, (y ⊕ z) ⊗ x = y ⊗ x ⊕ z ⊗ x
Record ring_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_rt { Radd_0_l : forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x; Radd_comm : forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x); Radd_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z); Rmul_1_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x; Rmul_comm : forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x); Rmul_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z); Rdistr_l : forall x y z : R, req (rmul (radd x y) z) (radd (rmul x z) (rmul y z));...
Z.lt = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y)%Z = Lt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
BinPosDef.Pos.mul = fix mul (x y : positive) {struct x} : positive := match x with | (p~1)%positive => (y + (mul p y)~0)%positive | (p~0)%positive => ((mul p y)~0)%positive | 1%positive => y end : positive -> positive -> positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.mul (_ _)%positive_scope
mk_monoid : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), (forall x : X, m u x = x) -> (forall x : X, m x u = x) -> (forall x y z : X, m x (m y z) = m (m x y) z) -> monoid_theory m u
Zp_mult_revert : forall x i : Z_Zp, i ⊗ x = Op -> is_gcd p (proj1_sig x) 1
Zp_mult = fun H : Z_Zp => let (x, _) := H in fun H0 : Z_Zp => let (y, _) := H0 in exist (fun x0 : nat => x0 < p) (rem (x * y) p) (div_rem_spec2 (x * y) Hp) : Z_Zp -> Z_Zp -> Z_Zp
Zp_plus = fun H : Z_Zp => let (x, _) := H in fun H0 : Z_Zp => let (y, _) := H0 in exist (fun x0 : nat => x0 < p) (rem (x + y) p) (div_rem_spec2 (x + y) Hp) : Z_Zp -> Z_Zp -> Z_Zp
Zp_one_invertible = ex_intro (fun i : Z_Zp => i ⊗ Op = Op) Op (let hyp_list := nil in let fv_list := nil in Zp_ring_ring_lemma1 ring_subst_niter fv_list hyp_list (Ring_polynom.PEmul Ring_polynom.PEI Ring_polynom.PEI) Ring_polynom.PEI I (eq_refl <: (let lmp := Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list 0%Z 1%Z Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem hyp_list in Ring_polynom.Peq Zeq_bool (Ring_polynom.norm_subst 0%Z 1%Z Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem ring_subst_niter lmp (Ring_polynom.PEmul Ring_polynom.PEI Ring_polynom.PEI)) (Ring_polynom.norm_subst 0%Z 1%Z Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem ring_subst_niter lmp Ring_polynom.PEI)) = true)) : Zp_invertible Op
Zp_mult_invert : forall x, is_gcd p (proj1_sig x) 1 -> {i : Z_Zp | i ⊗ x = Op}
Zeq_bool = fun x y : Z => match (x ?= y)%Z with | Eq => true | _ => false end : Z -> Z -> bool Arguments Zeq_bool (_ _)%Z_scope
divides_trans : forall x y z : nat, divides x y -> divides y z -> divides x z
Init.Nat.divmod = fix divmod (x y q u : nat) {struct x} : nat * nat := match x with | 0 => (q, u) | S x' => match u with | 0 => divmod x' y (S q) y | S u' => divmod x' y q u' end end : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat -> nat * nat Arguments Init.Nat.divmod (_ _ _ _)%nat_scope
exist : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A), P x -> {x : A | P x}
Zp_inj : forall x y, proj1_sig x = proj1_sig y -> x = y
Record monoid_theory (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X) : Prop := mk_monoid { monoid_unit_l : forall x : X, m u x = x; monoid_unit_r : forall x : X, m x u = x; monoid_assoc : forall x y z : X, m x (m y z) = m (m x y) z } Arguments monoid_theory [X]%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments mk_monoid [X]%type_scope _%function_scope _ (_ _ _)%function_scope

snd = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (_, y) := p in y : forall A B : Type, A * B -> B Arguments snd {A B}%type_scope
Nat.divide = fun x y : nat => exists z : nat, y = z * x : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.divide (_ _)%nat_scope
lt_pirr : forall (x y : nat) (H1 H2 : x < y), H1 = H2
Init.Nat.div = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => fst (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.div (_ _)%nat_scope
rem_lt : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall a : nat, a < p -> rem a p = a
div_eq_0 : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall n : nat, n < p -> div n p = 0
Init.Nat.modulo = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => y' - snd (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.modulo (_ _)%nat_scope
BinPosDef.Pos.sub = fun x y : positive => match BinPosDef.Pos.sub_mask x y with | BinPosDef.Pos.IsPos z => z | _ => 1%positive end : positive -> positive -> positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.sub (_ _)%positive_scope
rem_diag : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem p p = 0

Nat.gcd_wd = fun (x x' : nat) (Hx : x = x') (y y' : nat) (Hy : y = y') => Nat.gcd_unique x y (Nat.gcd x' y') (Nat.gcd_nonneg x' y') ((fun lemma : x = x' => Morphisms.Reflexive_partial_app_morphism (Morphisms.subrelation_proper Nat.divide_wd tt (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl eq) (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl eq) Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation))) (Morphisms.reflexive_proper_proxy RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive (Nat.gcd x' y')) x x' lemma) Hx (Nat.gcd_divide_l x' y')) ((fun lemma : y = y' => Morphisms.Reflexive_partial_app_morphism (Morphisms.subrelation_proper Nat.divide_wd tt (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl eq) (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation...
div_rem_spec2 : forall q p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem q p < p

```coq
intros.
unfold Zp_invertible in *.
destruct H as [i Hx].
destruct H0 as [j Hy].
exists (i ⊗ j).
rewrite Zp_mult_assoc.
rewrite Hx.
rewrite Hy.
auto.
